meals.recipe_name: Grilled Chicken and Sweet Potato Hash
Grilled Salmon with Roasted Sweet Potatoes

recipes.name: Avocado Toast
steps: Begin by toasting the whole wheat bread until it's lightly browned and crispy.
While the bread is toasting, slice the avocado in half and remove the pit.
Mash the avocado in a bowl with a fork until it's mostly smooth.
Once the bread is toasted, spread the mashed avocado on top of each slice.
Sprinkle a pinch of salt on top of the avocado for added flavor.
Serve and enjoy!

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken and Quinoa Bowl
steps: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breast with your favorite seasonings and grill for 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
While the chicken is cooking, cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Toss the mixed vegetables with a little bit of oil and seasoning, and sauté in a pan until tender.
To assemble the bowl, slice the grilled chicken and place on top of the cooked quinoa and mixed vegetables.
Serve and enjoy!

recipes.name: Lentil and Sweet Potato Curry
steps: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the curry powder and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the lentils and sweet potatoes to the pan, and stir to combine.
Add enough water to the pan to cover the lentils and sweet potatoes, and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils and sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve over rice or with naan bread.

recipes.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
steps: Layer the Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries in a bowl.
Repeat the layers until all the ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of yogurt on top.
Serve chilled and enjoy!

recipes.name: Chickpea and Avocado Salad
steps: Mash the avocado in a bowl with a fork until it's mostly smooth.
Add the chickpeas to the bowl and stir to combine.
Squeeze the lemon juice over the top of the chickpea and avocado mixture, and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve on top of a bed of greens or as a sandwich filling.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
Place the salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
Toss the mixed vegetables with a little bit of oil and seasoning, and spread out in a single layer on the baking sheet around the salmon.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Spinach and Lentil Stew
steps: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the lentils and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the vegetable broth to the pan and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Avocado and Almond Smoothie
steps: Add the avocado, almond milk, and almonds to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add honey or maple syrup to taste, if desired.
Serve chilled and enjoy!

recipes.name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
steps: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Toss the cooked quinoa with the black beans, mixed vegetables, and a squeeze of lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken and Sweet Potato Hash
steps: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breast with your favorite seasonings and grill for 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
While the chicken is cooking, slice the sweet potatoes into thin rounds.
Toss the sweet potato slices with a little bit of oil and seasoning, and grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until tender.
To assemble the hash, chop the cooked chicken and sweet potatoes into small pieces and stir to combine.
Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Chickpea and Spinach Salad
steps: Mash the chickpeas in a bowl with a fork until they're mostly smooth.
Stir in the spinach and lemon juice until the spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve on top of a bed of greens or as a sandwich filling.

recipes.name: Baked Chicken and Roasted Vegetables
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
Place the chicken breast on the prepared baking sheet.
Toss the mixed vegetables with a little bit of oil and seasoning, and spread out in a single layer on the baking sheet around the chicken.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Quinoa and Banana Pancakes
steps: Mash the bananas in a bowl with a fork until they're mostly smooth.
Stir in the quinoa and eggs until well combined.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.
Drop the batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto the pan or griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until bubbles appear on the surface and the edges start to dry.
Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken and Avocado Wrap
steps: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breast with your favorite seasonings and grill for 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
While the chicken is cooking, slice the avocado into thin pieces.
Warm the whole wheat tortilla by wrapping it in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds.
Assemble the wrap by slicing the cooked chicken and placing it in the center of the tortilla, topping with avocado and your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Lentil and Vegetable Stew
steps: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the lentils and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the mixed vegetables and vegetable broth to the pan, and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast with Poached Eggs
steps: Toast the whole wheat bread until lightly browned and crispy.
Mash the avocado in a bowl with a fork until mostly smooth.
Spread the mashed avocado on top of the toasted bread.
Poach the eggs by cracking them into a pot of simmering water and cooking for 3-5 minutes, or until the whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your desired doneness.
Place the poached eggs on top of the avocado toast and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chickpea and Quinoa Bowl
steps: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Toss the cooked quinoa with the chickpeas, mixed vegetables, and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon with Roasted Sweet Potatoes
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
Place the sweet potatoes on the prepared baking sheet and toss with a little bit of oil and seasoning.
Roast in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender.
While the sweet potatoes are roasting, preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season the salmon fillets with your favorite seasonings and grill for 4-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Serve the grilled salmon on top of the roasted sweet potatoes and enjoy!
